intro: Acmella filipes var. cayensis, commonly known as the Cayenne velvetleaf, is a tropical perennial plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist lowland areas. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through rhizomes make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
